H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6299.def: = causative action by which humans exchange animals or other humans by substituting them with money or with an(other) animal, ► as a result of which they will escape death or slavery

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H226.def: = an object that represents and identifies a group of people; in the form of a flag or a metal or wooden board, often with an image; attached to a pole so that it can be carried; used in both military and religious contexts

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H4159.def: = object or event that reminds of something that has happened or as a confirmation of something that is yet to happen

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H6814.def: = town; ◄ located in {L:Nile<SDBH:יְאֹר>} delta of {L:Egypt<SDBH:מִצְרַיִם>}; ► Egyptian capital during 21st and 22nd dynasties; administrative centre of Lower Egypt

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H2975.def: = a river ◄ flowing through Egypt from south to north; ► overflowing its banks each year and providing fertility for the fields on both sides; ≈ generally associated with Egypt's power and prosperity

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H5140.def: poetic term; = process by which liquids or odors move from one place to another

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H6157.def: literally: mixture; possibly a general term for a large group of insects

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H6854.def: = amphibious small animal with large hind legs used for jumping; about 70 mm. long; brown or olive-green in color; lays eggs which hatch as tadpoles and gradually grow legs; ◄ Edible Frog (|iRana esculenta|i*) or Spotted Frog (|iRana punctata|i*); ► unclean; ≈ associated with demons by Egyptians and Persians

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H2981.def: = general term for plants that are sources of food; ≈ a sign of God's blessing

H2625.def: exact meaning unkown; probably: = juvenile form of {L:locust<SDBH:אַרְבֶּה>}

H3018.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious work which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H697.def: = six-legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten

H2026.def: = causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

H1612.def: = a creeping plant, which grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils

H1259.def: = pellets of frozen rain falling from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction

H8256.def: = a tree up to 10 m high with large low, spreading branches; its fruit grows in bunches on the trunk and branches of the tree rather than among the leaves; ◄ Ficus sycomorus; ► its fruit is edible but not as juicy or sweet as the more common variety of fig; ≈ image of something plentiful

H2602.def: meaning not entirely clear; among the possibilities are: = (a) heavy rains resulting in a destructive flood ({A:REB} {A:CEV}); (b) state of extreme cold, destructive to certain kinds of trees and other vegetation ({A:RSV} {A:GNT}); (c) snow or hail melting while falling ({A:NIV})

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H1165.def: collective: = animals that have been domesticated

H1259.def: = pellets of frozen rain falling from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction

H4735.def: = an animate or inanimate object ◄ acquired by humans by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H7565.def: = a sudden burst of brighly glowing light, whose source can be seen (like fire) or invisible (like lightning)

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H2740.def: = process by which objects become extremely dry ► and therefore highly inflammable

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H2195.def: = action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H4917.def: = action by which humans allow other humans not to participate in a certain action

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H6424.def: literally: to make level (a road or path for someone else); hence: = causative action by which deities allow humans to make their journey to life without major obstacles

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H2820.def: = causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H1698.def: in a strict sense: = an epidemic disease ► that causes high mortality; in a wider sense: = any widespread affliction, calamity, or evil, ≈ especially one regarded as a direct punishment by God

H1060.def: = first offspring of any female; ► in the case of humans, the main heir of estate and blessing

H4714.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}; ► regarded as founder of the {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} nation

H7225.def: = point in time at which an event starts happening

H202.def: = state of being physically strong and healthy which usually includes the ability of producing children

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H5265.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H5090.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to journey from one place to the other, whether with force or not

H5739.def: = a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H983.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H6342.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of strong emotions of joy, awe, or fear

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H1366.def: = a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H1644.def: = process by which large bodies of water move back and forth as a result of natural forces

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H5254.def: = action by which humans or deities make an effort to obtain information about (other) humans by observing them while they engage in a certain activity

H4784.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler or deity to which they had formerly been subjected

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5945.def: = state of being in an elevated position

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H7423.def: = state or condition of a person unequipped or unwilling to work or be attentive to responsibilities

H7198.def: = a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

H3707.def: = state/process by which humans or deities experience displeasure; ◄ caused by someone else's condition or behavior

H7065.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H6456.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5203.def: = process by which ropes that used to be tightly strung begin to hang loose

H4908.def: = location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

H7887.def: = man, possibly to be identified with {L:Shelah<SDBH:שֵׁלָה>}; ◄ son of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}׃ ► regarded as father of inhabitants of {L:Shiloh<SDBH:שִׁילֹה>}

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H970.def: = a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength

H1330.def: = young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3364.def: = process by which humans wake up from sleep

H3463.def: = state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with death, sometimes with being inactive

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H268.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H3130.def: = man; ◄ eleventh son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and first son of {L:Rachel<SDBH:רָחֵל>}; ► father of {L:Ephraim<SDBH:אֶפְרַיִם>} and {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}, each founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H669.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of {L:Joseph<SDBH:יֹוסֵף>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

51.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

41.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H4720.def: = part of an object that is considered more holy than the rest

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3245.def: = causative action by which humans put in place the bottom part of a building or larger structure, usually below the ground level, which will have to bear the entire construction

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H4356.def: = area enclosed by a stone wall or hedge made of branches and thorns, with a narrow opening which can be closed with brush or by the shepherd’s body; ► used for keeping sheep at night to protect them from thieves or wild animals

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H3290.def: = man, also known as {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}; ◄ second son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; ► one of the patriarchs of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H8537.def: literally: completeness; hence: = state in which humans are considered morally blameless, with profound moral uprightness and integrity

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.
